# excuse_api.py
import os, json, time, hashlib
from pathlib import Path
from dotenv import load_dotenv
load_dotenv()          # ← NEW: pulls OPENAI_API_KEY from .env
from fastapi import FastAPI
from pydantic import BaseModel
from openai import OpenAI
# ---------- OpenAI client ----------
client = OpenAI(api_key=os.getenv("OPENAI_API_KEY"))

# ---------- simple “DB” ----------
DATA = Path("history.json")
if not DATA.exists():
    DATA.write_text("[]")          # seed empty list



# ---------- FastAPI app ----------
app = FastAPI()

class Req(BaseModel):
    scenario: str  # e.g. "missed class"
    urgency: str   # "low" | "medium" | "panic"

SYSTEM_PROMPT = """
You are an elite alibi-creator.
Return a JSON with:
  excuse               (≤ 50 words),
  believability_score  (0-1),
  chat_log             (short WhatsApp-style proof)
"""

# ---------- /generate ----------
@app.post("/generate")
def generate(r: Req):
    prompt = f"Scenario: {r.scenario}\nUrgency: {r.urgency}"
    res = client.chat.completions.create(
        model="gpt-4o-mini",
        messages=[
            {"role": "system", "content": SYSTEM_PROMPT},
            {"role": "user",   "content": prompt},
        ],
        temperature=0.8,
    )
    out = json.loads(res.choices[0].message.content)

    entry = {
        "id": hashlib.md5(out["excuse"].encode()).hexdigest(),
        "ts": time.time(),
        **out,
    }

    history = json.loads(DATA.read_text())
    if entry["id"] not in {h["id"] for h in history}:   # de-dupe
        history.append(entry)
        DATA.write_text(json.dumps(history, indent=2))

    return entry

# ---------- /top?n=5 ----------
@app.get("/top")
def top(n: int = 5):
    history = json.loads(DATA.read_text())
    history.sort(key=lambda x: x["believability_score"], reverse=True)
    return history[:n]

should i be doing this project on google colab

Colab isn't a silver-bullet—use it only for the parts it’s good at

Your FastAPI “excuse-generator” needs two very different kinds of work:

What you'll do

Quick notebooks: data scraping, prompt-
engineering experiments, evaluating Gemini
vs. OpenAl responses, one-off plots.

Arunning web service: FastAPI + .env
secrets + persistent storage (history.json
or a DB) + an endpoint you can hit from
outside.

Best place

Google Colab (free GPU / TPU, shareable
notebook links, nothing to install).

Local dev (VS Code) > push to GitHub >
deploy to Render/Fly/GCP Cloud Run/HF
Spaces.

If you really want to demo FastAPI from Colab

You can, but it’s a hacky workaround:

1. Create a notebook > first cell installs deps:

python
